clinical_study.brief_title: Speech and Swallowing Characteristics of Patients After Laryngectomy and the Effect on Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Speech and Swallowing Characteristics of Patients After Laryngectomy and the Effect on Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock: Swallowing and speech difficulties will be observed in patients post laryngectomy. These difficulties will cause decreased in quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will explore the characteristics of speech and swallowing problems of patients who underwent laryngectomy.The relationship between swallowing disturbances and speech difficulties will be studied and the effect of each problem on quality of life will be messured.

primary_outcome.measure: Speech and swallowing characteristics of patients post laryngectomy
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the completion of data collection -1 year
primary_outcome.description: After recording the patients' speech the speech characteristics will be analysed according to specific parameters. Also after performing swallowing eveluation swallowing disturbances will be diagnosed and described.

secondary_outcome.measure: The relationship between speech and swallowing disturbances of patients post laryngectomy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year at the completion of data collection
secondary_outcome.description: After analyzing the speech and swallowing disturbances of patients post laryngectomy, the relationship between these variables will be examined.

arm_group.description: A group of patients who underwent total laryngectomy with trechea esophageal puncture (TEP)

study_pop.textblock: 40 adult patients, ages 35-80 y/o who underwent total laryngectomy and a trechea esophageal puncture was performed for the use of voice prothesis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients post total laryngectomy with voice prothesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who can not read and respod to questions
